programme.title: Channel Islands at War
programme.desc: John Nettles discovers more about the desperate last year of the Second World War on the islands and the locals' reliance on Red Cross parcels.

programme.title: Find My Past

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on their 200th dig, examining the bed of a reservoir in a valley high up on Dartmoor in Devon. The specially drained site presents difficulties with its abundance of thick mud, but the archaeological experts uncover a network of monuments that suggests the existence of a major prehistoric site. Their efforts are further rewarded with the discovery of the first stone henge in Britain for a century.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Unexplained events during wartime, including German submarines that discovered previously unknown sea creatures and a Japanese bomb that floated on the jet stream.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: Documentary featuring dramatic reconstructions and interviews with historians to examine the network of spymasters and secret agents that helped protect Elizabeth I from assassination, terror and treason for more than 40 years. The first edition reveals how the pope's declaration of Elizabeth as a heretic 12 years into her reign set England's Catholics against her, leading the queen to charge William Cecil with the task of stopping assassins getting through, and the huge espionage network he established saw his spies break Catholic conspiracies at home and abroad.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team investigates acres of overgrown gardens surrounding Upton Castle in Pembrokeshire, the centre of a romantic mystery for owners Steve and Pru Barlow. The pair bought what looked like a medieval castle at the front and a Victorian mansion at the back, leaving the origins of the complex unclear. The group digs trenches to look for a courtyard, while building specialists crawl through the roof and an excavation for the remains of a drawbridge takes place. Presented by Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate a site in Leicestershire, which they believe contains an Anglo-Saxon burial ground. Though their initial search for a cemetery proves fruitless, more digging leads to the experts uncovering evidence of several types of funeral, as well as a highly valuable piece of jewellery - and one member of the team volunteers to take part in a re-creation of a cremation ceremony from the period.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: In a special 20th anniversary celebration for the programme, Tony Robinson relives the best bits from more than 200 episodes, taking in major highlights such as digging up the garden of Buckingham Palace to reveal a crashed Spitfire and discovering the first stone circle to be found in Britain for 150 years. There is a reminder of how the show grew from nervous beginnings in a Somerset field into attempting city-wide digs and promoting nationwide events in which thousands of people spent the weekend digging in their own backyards.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: War of the Roses: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Britain's Lost Roman Circus: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson reports on the discovery of a Roman circus in Colchester, Essex, the only one known to have been built in Britain. Experts Phil Harding and Guy de la Bedoyere examine the artefacts found at the site, reveal the dangerous life of a charioteer and discover one of the most famous incidents in the town's history - when Emperor Claudius made a royal visit on the back of an elephant.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Boudica's Lost Tribe: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson traces the story of the warrior queen, following an excavation in Norfolk that may hold clues to what happened to her tribe, the Iceni, after its defeat at the hands of the Romans. The presenter visits Caistor St Edmund to investigate whether the Empire crushed Boudica's people or if she unwittingly led them to destruction.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Pugin - The God of Gothic: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson follows the renovation of the Grange, a house in Ramsgate, Kent, formerly owned by 19th-century architect Augustus Pugin, co-creator of the Houses of Parliament. Pugin's designs for the home became a blueprint for thousands of properties built after his death and in 20 years he succeeded in changing the face of England. With the help of experts such as Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud, the Landmark Trust aims to restore a piece of history.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Saxon Hoard: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: An investigation of the Anglo-Saxon treasure discovered in Staffordshire in 2009, with analysts in Paris and from the British Museum having traced the materials used to Turkey, India and Sri Lanka. Some of the hoard was discovered to be made from recycled jewellery and luxury goods, leading to a better understanding of Britain's Dark Ages and shedding light on the skills of those who made the items. Tony Robinson presents.

programme.title: The Day They Dropped the Bomb
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Featuring a minute-by-minute account of what happened on that tragic day, through archive footage and interviews with eyewitnesses who rarely speak about their experience of the bombing. Also interviewed is navigator Theodore Van Kirk, who was the last surviving member of the crew who dropped the bomb, before his death in 2014.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The largest evacuation of the Second World War, which saw two million civilians and soldiers removed in an extraordinary German operation that lasted for four months.

programme.title: Flying Scotsman with Robson Green
programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. Starting in February, Robson is given the task of cutting off the front end of the Scotsman and welding on a whole piece, and sets out to Durham, where he discovers how the invention of the steam engine helped to change the world. After a year in the workshop, the iconic train is ready for its first test run, and Robson realises a lifelong dream and gets to ride on the footplate as it sets off.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The documentary exploring historical mysteries returns, beginning with Jamie Theakston looking at the lost city of Petra in Jordan. The presenter questions whether any treasures still lie beneath the site in hidden tombs, and enlists the help of local historians.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates one of history's most enduring mysteries as he goes on a world-wide search for the Holy Grail, visiting Glastonbury in Somerset, Wales, Valencia in Spain, and New York City to inspect four goblets that could be the ancient relic.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: Documentary featuring dramatic reconstructions and interviews with historians to examine the network of spymasters and secret agents that helped protect Elizabeth I from assassination, terror and treason for more than 40 years. The first edition reveals how the pope's declaration of Elizabeth as a heretic 12 years into her reign set England's Catholics against her, leading the queen to charge William Cecil with the task of stopping assassins getting through, and the huge espionage network he established saw his spies break Catholic conspiracies at home and abroad.

programme.desc: Kerry confides in Cameron about her rape ordeal but Gabriel denies the allegations, and her despair is compounded when her fiance begins to doubt the truth of her story. A harrowing interview with the Sun Hill rapist's latest victim leaves the traumatised copper agonising over whether to make an official report about her attack - can she muster the courage to go through with it? Elsewhere, Samantha faces a dilemma of her own as she prepares a statement on the events surrounding Weaver's demise.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gabriel once again steps outside the bounds of the law, unleashing his gang of thugs on two youths who have been tormenting an elderly lady, but the unexpected return of an old ally could mean his days as a vigilante are numbered. Meanwhile, Sam turns to a police profiler for help in tracking down the Sun Hill serial rapist, Sheelagh finds herself accused of racism, and a race to save two children from drowning has a profound effect on Honey and Cameron.

programme.desc: Nick is up to his old tricks, while Clyde admits to Etta that he is out of his league. Mark tries to avoid a newcomer to the Square, and Celestine is against Hattie working for Ian.

Meanwhile, Charlie and Baz arrange a social meeting after work, but he is put off when he sees her husband is also present.

programme.title: Lovejoy

programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Billy offer words of wisdom to a broken-hearted man they find seeking solace in the woods. Peter Sallis and Hywel Bennett star.

programme.desc: Sandra reopens an investigation into the suspected suicide of a Foreign Office diplomat, whose body was found in a frozen London lake after she had suffered the personal tragedy of a miscarriage and the professional embarrassment of having a government laptop stolen from her home. The woman's fiance and twin sister both believe her death is connected to sensitive information held on the missing computer and blame her boss for her downfall - and when Sandra clashes with the man himself, it only makes her more determined to pursue the conspiracy theory, despite Strickland's advice to tread carefully. Simon Day and Sharon Small guest star.

Nikki sees a barefoot girl being knocked over by a car, marking the beginning of a case that takes the team into the harrowing world of sex grooming and teenage prostitution. The police know the girl has been abused and suspicion soon falls on her stepfather. Meanwhile, an early-morning bath saves Harry's life, and two puzzling corpses are brought in to the centre - a heavily tattooed man and a decomposed body found at the airport. Guest starring Sanjeev Bhaskar, Elyes Gabel and Madeline Duggan.

programme.desc: The sisters decide to launch their new collection two weeks before that of a leading rival, causing unforeseen repercussions. Unable to agree on designs, Beatrice and Evie have a blazing row. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.desc: Two new nurses struggle to make a good impression on their first day as one of them questions Mubbs's judgement, while the other gives her superiors cheek and stuns Diane by revealing she spent the night with Peter. Meanwhile, Jess grows closer to her patient Robert Pullman, causing Lisa and Ric to worry she has more than just a professional interest in him. Kath feels uncomfortable with Larry's spontaneity, but he is determined to win her round.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gabriel once again steps outside the bounds of the law, unleashing his gang of thugs on two youths who have been tormenting an elderly lady, but the unexpected return of an old ally could mean his days as a vigilante are numbered. Meanwhile, Sam turns to a police profiler for help in tracking down the Sun Hill serial rapist, Sheelagh finds herself accused of racism, and a race to save two children from drowning has a profound effect on Honey and Cameron.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Already haunted by Kerry's rape, Cameron is plunged into further emotional torment after failing to save the two drowning children. Sam's hunt for the Sun Hill rapist is jeopardised by a witness's suicide attempt and alarm bells ring for Ken when he spies the matriarch of a notorious criminal clan thought to have been in exile abroad. Guest starring Lynda Bellingham.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark feels he is being brushed off, while Ian gets told off by Pete. John pays Eddie a surprise visit, Michelle has her eye on promotion and Nick shows improvement.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie is determined to keep her job with Ian, Eddie is overjoyed to see Eibhlin, Rachel has some explaining to do to Michelle, and people are unaware of Mark's situation.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An unstable woman, whose baby died before being christened, steals a sick infant from the hospital, while a retiring detective constable confesses his partner caused an accident in which several lives were put at risk. Elsewhere, Charlie tells Baz he wishes to end their affair.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A property developer approaches Lady Jane's husband and offers him a business partnership, making Lovejoy suspicious. Starring Ian McShane, with guest appearances by Nicky Henson and Sherrie Hewson.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A hard-up major tries to raise cash by selling his memoirs - but Jim warns him about the dangers of strolling down memory lane. Ian Hendey guest stars in the detective drama, alongside John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William learns that getting fired in French sounds just the same as it does in English, but the Fields know they can always go back to England if the worst comes to the worst.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Bad-tempered Mr Grainger is deemed too long in the tooth to continue at Grace Brothers and calls are made for his resignation. Classic comedy, starring Arthur Brough and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances

Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.

programme.desc: An old friend asks the detective to investigate the death of his father, which he is convinced should be treated as murder. Drama, starring Kenneth Branagh and Tom Hiddleston, with Rupert Graves, Angela Thorne and Vincent Regan.

programme.desc: Retired detective Steve McAndrew arrives from Glasgow to help reinvestigate one of his original cases when a missing girl's DNA is found at the scene of a petrol station robbery in Clapham, south London. It's clear that the inquiry is a very personal one for McAndrew, and although his personality rubs the team up the wrong way, his methods soon pay dividends. Denis Lawson stars.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is furious with Leo when he re-examines a child abuse case by her former mentor, leading to conflict between the pathologists. But she soon has more to worry about when a workman at the centre reveals how his mother is being manipulated by a convicted serial killer into searching for his hidden teenage victims.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: The House of Eliott

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Shauna admits to having an affair with Mooney, Sally gets an unexpected visitor and George finally comes clean about his failing eyesight.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team takes action when a block of flats catches fire. Meanwhile, an old flame causes trouble for George. Starring Anthony Green and Glen Murphy.

programme.sub-title: The Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part One

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A civil servant is exposed as a spy and, while fleeing to Russia, she stops off in Jersey - unaware her Soviet contact, the man she is also in love with, has been ordered to kill her.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Shifty slinks back home to Grandad's. As Billy's ex-wife moves away, the lovely Leonora moves in to her old house.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The body of a missing computer expert turns up in a hospital morgue under a false name, so the team reopens the investigation into his disappearance. The dead man worked for the Metropolitan Police, giving him access to a great deal of sensitive information - added to which, he was in contact with a group of online hackers. But he died of natural causes - so why was his body hidden, and by who? As the seasoned detectives unravel the mystery, Brian struggles to accept Steve as the new Ucos member, forcing Esther to intervene. Guest starring Sarah Smart and Alex Jennings.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry is disturbed to be called to a crime scene at the home of a family he knows, and finds the bodies of the mother and her teenage daughter, while her stepson lies in a coma - although her toddler has been left unharmed. The police suspect the woman's husband to be the killer, but the pathologist is not so sure of his guilt.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters decide to change the theme of their show, but a flu epidemic puts them behind schedule.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: A ballet company commissions the sisters to design its costumes, a deal which could lead to both fame and fortune for their fashion house - but Jack is concerned over the amount of time the choreographer is spending with Beatrice. programme.desc: After finally deciding on a theme for the forthcoming collection, the girls are introduced to a renowned fashion writer - who all but ruins their career. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Part one of two. An out-of-control satellite hurtles toward Earth, and Blue Watch's troubles are multiplied when a gas leak at an illegal rave turns into a major disaster.

programme.title: Holby City

programme.desc: Nick Cotton has lied, cheated and stolen, and now it's going to stop - even if Dot has to lock him up.

programme.desc: Sharon's fight to regain her job goes to an industrial tribunal.

programme.desc: The Jersey detective becomes an unwelcome guest at a wedding while investigating an attack on a curate. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The prospect of a royal visitor to the store sends the staff into a flag-waving frenzy of patriotic fervour. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Mollie Sugden and Wendy Richard.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth attends an exclusive auction, while Daisy and Rose try to cool the ardour of a woman who seems determined to marry Daddy. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Judy Cornwell and Josephine Tewson.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Theodore Roosevelt sneaks into Canada for a hunting trip, but Murdoch discovers that the American president is the prey of a killer.

programme.desc: The death of a teenage tennis star occupies the team when it is suggested her suicide jump two years earlier was anything but. They soon find several people with motives for her murder, including her coach Nick and agent Anthony, but it seems the one with the most to benefit from the girl's demise was her great rival Fawn Brammall - a shy and subdued player who proves difficult to question. Meanwhile, Gerry wonders if he did enough to encourage his own daughter's sporting ambitions and Brian hatches a plan to turn his dog into a movie star. Detective drama, guest starring Tamzin Outhwaite and Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. There is little sympathy when child-killer James Wade dies in his cell, but Leo's encounter with dying ex-prison inspector Rachel Kruger compels him to investigate the notorious Redhill jail - only to come up against a wall of silence. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wade's sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brother's killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.desc: The sisters decide to launch their new collection two weeks before that of a leading rival, causing unforeseen repercussions. Unable to agree on designs, Beatrice and Evie have a blazing row. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.desc: Military drama series charting the lives of the men and women of the King's Own Fusiliers regiment. In the opening episode, the officers return from a tour in Northern Ireland after tragedy strikes. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gary is sent on an undercover mission to ferret out information about his estranged brother Joe's criminal activities - but CID soon have reason to suspect family ties could undermine his loyalty to the force. Meanwhile, as June fights for life in hospital, Jim makes some pointed remarks to Tony that leave him in an agony of guilt and remorse.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: An unwelcome visitor spells danger for Joe and Mark. Grant has an idea to cheer up Sharon, and Michelle is delighted when Clyde seems more friendly toward her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant promises to get Sharon back into the Queen Vic by fair means or foul.

programme.title: Casualty

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer returns from six months in Spain to find a guest of Lady Jane has fled Peru with a priceless Inca ring. Joanna Lumley guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim believes a former golf pro is behind a spate of robberies but, with no proof to back up his suspicions, he cannot prevent the suspect from leaving Jersey. Drama, starring John Nettles and Sean Arnold.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill turns up with some sad news for Freddie, Joey rents a shop and Shifty gets a job as a bus driver.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Young Mr Grace opens a social club for his employees, and they decide to decorate it in their own inimitable style. John Inman, Mollie Sugden, and Trevor Bannister star.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth cannot suppress her excitement when she hears Emmet is rehearsing an amateur production of The Boyfriend, and resolves to land herself a part in the show. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is found in a seemingly idyllic Northumberland coastal village in 1966, and the subsequent investigation leads Gently and Bacchus to suspect the victim's estranged husband is responsible for the killing. However, they soon come to realise her disturbed family is hiding an even more shocking secret. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

Gerry becomes convinced the victim's links with the criminal fraternity led to his demise, but Brian has a different theory, believing the secret of his murder lies in his verse. Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo visits old college friend Sean Delaney at his psychiatric care centre in Essex, where one of the patients has been found dead in her bed. Although the coroner ruled a verdict of sudden-death syndrome, Delaney is not convinced and asks Leo to investigate. Suspicion soon falls on the dead girl's father, who has lost the family fortune, and his wife - but the pathologist runs into problems when the local detective sergeant makes it clear she is suspicious of his motives. Adrian Dunbar, Tamzin Outhwaite and Tom Ellis guest star.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The net starts to tighten around Ralph Saroyan when more is discovered about his secret financial dealings. Meanwhile, Evie's affair with Treasury Minister Lord Montford threatens the future of the company, and Bea's marriage continues to flounder.

programme.title: The House of Eliott

programme.desc: A robbery at the local museum sets Lovejoy off on the trail of a hoard of Roman coins hidden on the Isle of Man - but he soon discovers two Americans are also searching for it. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A bereaved couple hire Lovejoy to find a pair of Regency duelling pistols and bring about the downfall of a murderer - but to complete the task he is forced to risk Jane's life and fight a duel. Anthony Valentine guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is drawn into a serious family dispute by an American woman who believes her father murdered her mother and wants him deported back to Florida to stand trial. John Nettles stars.

programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Crime author Jack Rudd visits Brokenwood to give a reading at the local book club - but he never leaves, falling victim to a method of murder portrayed in his own book.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a murder connected to vaudeville entertainers Harry and Al Jolson, while Watts unravels a mystery about his own family.

programme.desc: Frankie suspects sabotage when a baseball player dies mid-game, but her investigation puts her at odds with ruthless mobster Bessie Starkman. Crime drama, starring Lauren Lee Smith.

programme.desc: April is pregnant, and not everyone is as supportive as Matt had hoped, but the netball game between the hospital and mining company takes all the focus.

programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. Guest starring Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The unexplained death of a newborn baby delivered by Cynthia puts the midwife under intense scrutiny from the police and the pregnant women of Poplar, placing immense strain on her work and health as she questions her own abilities. Chummy faces pressure of a different kind as she and PC Noakes pursue a dream which could bring exciting changes for the couple, while a chance encounter returns Jimmy to Jenny's life - with surprising results. Bryony Hannah, Miranda Hart and Jessica Raine star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is seconded to a short-staffed hospital in London, but grows increasingly reluctant to carry out her duties when she finds out she is working under intimidating surgeon Mr Tracey. Back in Poplar, the midwives are introduced to newcomer Jane and outspoken twins Meg and Mave Carter. The sisters are identical in every way, except one of them is now pregnant - forcing them to come to terms with the impact a baby will have on them. Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Not fully convinced the man is innocent, Boyd tries to find the rest of the family to establish the truth, but when he does eventually track the relatives down, he realises they have a lot to hide. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The detective oversteps the mark and finds himself sent back to the Police Training College to learn some professional etiquette and save his pension. Sidekick DS Siobhan Clarke is left to investigate the murder of an art dealer, but it is not long before her boss turns up on the trail of the killer. Ken Stott stars in the crime drama, with Claire Price and Jennifer Black.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the dealers are in Warwick, where David Hakeney assesses a silver box and Fay Rutter is offered a decorative glass bowl and a ruby and diamond ring.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.desc: Dawn uncovers Al's secret, Jacob is determined to make things right, and Charity gives Tracy some advice.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: The police come calling for Kel, and Michael begs Grace to give him another chance. Meanwhile, Nick outlines his vision for an all-new Underworld.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: The financial journalist and co-host Angellica Bell returns with more money-saving tips and advice, beginning with up-to-the-minute information on the impending deadline for the Help to Buy ISA scheme. Martin has also been travelling across the country answering the pressing financial concerns of the nation.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: A furious Kel locks Bernie inside No 5 with him, while Fiz and Tyrone blame Hope for the fire. Elsewhere, Michael pledges financial support for his daughter.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Tired, hungry, and missing their loved ones, the campmates have to keep one another's morale up as they find out who will face the next Bushtucker Trial. Ant and Dec also present round-up of all the goings-on over the past 24 hours.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland invite more teams of enthusiasts to compete to identify the rarest and most valuable items in stately homes around the country, continuing at Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: As police comb the haulage yard for clues, Nancy must hide her guilt from both a fraught Hayley and her colleagues, but realises she has left incriminating evidence at the scene. Newman mounts a risky armed operation to ensnare both Elliot and the truck, although events spiral out of control when Nancy goes unprotected into the lion's den - with unexpected and bloody consequences.

programme.desc: A special Christmas-themed live edition of the financial advice show, offering tips on the best shopping deals to be found in the run-up to the holidays. Martin will also be answering viewers' questions on any economic issues. With Angellica Bell.

programme.desc: Rageh Omaar introduces more reports from around the world. Tom Clarke investigates why Donald Trump wanted to buy Greenland, Richard Pallot reports on the impact of tourism on locals in Amsterdam and the introduction of on-the-spot fines for inebriated visitors, and Nina Nannar visits a 'rage room' in Paris, where people can relieve their tension through destroying things.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined in the studio by comedian, author and Britain's Got Talent judge David Walliams and Edward Norton, who has recently directed his second movie, crime drama Motherless Brooklyn. Also dropping in are the stars of the new Charlie's Angels movie, Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska, and Robbie Williams, who will be performing live.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: After a mystery sea monster washes up on a UK beach, extreme angler Jeremy Wade sets off on a journey to unmask this beast and find out whether it poses any threat to humans. His journey takes him to London, where he digs for clues among celebrated naturalist Charles Darwin's historic specimens, to the frozen waters of Greenland, where he ice fishes deeper than he's ever fished before, and on to the fjords of Norway, where he attempts to reel in one of these sea monsters before an Arctic storm rolls in.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach.

programme.title: A Very Yorkshire Brothel
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following a year in the life of a mother and daughter who run Sheffield massage parlour City Sauna in the heart of the city's red-light district. The programme meets the women who work there and their clients, and reveals the intricacies of the business and the fight to legalise the brothels of Britain.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen travels through Belize, the only former British colony in Central America, bottle-feeding injured manatees, hearing the music of the Garifuna people and meeting a reformed drug addict living 40 miles off the mainland on the Turneffe Flats. On arrival in Guatemala, he learns to weave with the Mayan people and teams up with an ex-Miss Guatemala on the banks of Lake Atitlan, before a night patrol with a volunteer heart surgeon.

programme.desc: David Dickinson heads to Liverpool along with the squad of dealers. Michael Hogben got time on his hands with some watches and Tracy-Thackeray-Howitt gets a centre-piece shock. Plus, Henry Nicholls and the den get blown away by a real rarity.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites contestants Paul, Ian, Caroline and Lucille to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy is happy to put the past behind him, Pete is concerned about Moira, and Kim is suspicious of Graham's motives.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz and Tyrone learn that Hope can return to school, and Roy criticises the inefficiency of Richard's carer. Meanwhile, Adam advises Michelle to abandon her plan.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec provide coverage of the latest stage in the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials. Which of them will start to crack under the pressure?.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the show in which a group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Today's contestants are a carnival dancer, a magician, a city worker and a sports therapist.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. Taking part this time round are Tanz & Bantz from Essex, and the Bowling Stones from Newcastle.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: It's a two part special, and Dana has made her own board game so that the whole family can learn about what happened to the Dinosaurs after a meteorite ended their kind.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A brilliant inventor plans to launch his newly constructed Hyperloop with a trial run, but when the machine begins to malfunction mid-circuit, it is up to Scott to find a way to slow it down. Animated adventure, with the voice of David Tennant.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: LEGO Jurassic World: The Legend of Isla Nublar
Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Prohyas and Vambre attempt to tame two of their most problematic Magiswords - Taunting Jester and Carnivorous Plant - with the help of Kablammica..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef is joined in the kitchen by husband and wife 1980s singers Martin and Shirlie Kemp, who have recently collaborated on an album of swing covers, as well as chef Stephen Terry and forager Alysia Vasey. Plus, Oz Clarke shares his tips on the best wine for a Christmas party and continues his tour of Britain's best pubs.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha re-creates the family feasts of China with chef Jeremy Pang. The menu comprises the street food snack jianbing for breakfast, prawn toasts with smacked cucumber for lunch, Jeremy's claypot chicken and mushroom rice for lunch and Nadia's banana fritters for dessert.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.00 Ladbrokes Trophy Steeple Chase, and races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.40 from Newbury, Plus, races at 2.05 and 3.20 from Newcastle. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald, Alice Plunkett, Rishi Persad, Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In the sixth episode, the comedian meets an albino Pekingese riddled with health problems, and in need of an operation on his eye, which is making it difficult for him to find a new home. Meanwhile, a dog rescued from a near death experience in the Thames needs help overcoming his nerves, and a Labrador puppy arrives with a mystery illness affecting his lungs.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as impressionist Rory Bremner, weather reporter Laura Tobin, Dragons' Den's Deborah Meaden and TV gardener and chat show host Alan Titchmarsh pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men to enter the 'love lift' are a Bruno Mars impersonator, a duck lover, a serial dater and a skip driver, who pull out all the stops in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the latest episode of the celebrity survival challenge, with the campmates facing the prospect of their third week in the jungle, with more tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials ahead of them - and for some, a ticket home.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests tennis champion Andy Murray, Luke Evans, recently seen in Second World War drama Midway, doctor-turned-comic and author of bestseller This is Going to Hurt Adam Kay, and comedian Desiree Burch. Plus, one of the biggest and hottest artists in the country, Stormzy, is chatting and performing in the studio.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring cats and their killer claws, makeshift dance floors and testing Newton's Laws.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Newcastle answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Mechanic finally completes Project Sentinel, and aims to test its destructive capabilities by making The Hood his first target. As the International Rescue team scrambles to save an old foe, Brains embarks on a dangerous mission to neutralise the Mechanic once and for all.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler attempts to make his own home movie, a horror thriller with Mrs Wicket in the starring role. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler has to look after Mrs Wicket's goldfish, but Scrapper the cat is keen to help. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's a beach lifeguard but is actually on an ice floe and the swimmers are penguins..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo's going to miss his flight. Unfortunately, he's not at the airport, but the supermarket, where Fizz and Weasel are hatching their latest plan..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: The Prophecy of the Goldensand'S Dragon
programme.desc: Fizz is at the beach building a sandcastle. Magoo thinks they are preparing to thwart an attack by an enemy riding a dragon..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Spy School
programme.desc: The budding spies are called into action against Goldfist at Chelsea Football Club, and uncover a plot with Eden Hazard himself.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet serves up a selection of bakes that involve spices. She makes spiced pumpkin pie with a meringue topping, chocolate and chilli cookies and winter pavlova with spiced apples and pears. She also visits a Lebanese bakery and is joined by food and travel writer John Gregory-Smith, who makes date and cinnamon squares.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are starting to feel festive with a few winter warmers. Lisa begins with a blue cheese and butternut squash pie, followed by John's sausage casserole. They also serve a family favourite - macaroni cheese, with a twist - and for dessert it's a classic ginger cake served two ways.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by Asimakis Chaniotis, London's youngest Michelin-starred chef, to create a family feast from Greece. The menu starts with scrambled eggs for breakfast and chicken gyros for lunch. Then Asimakis rustles up his mum's meatball soup for dinner before Nadia makes Greek almond crescent biscuits for dessert.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack AP Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the pefect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Globetrotting Emma is house hunting for love with the help of her cousin Kelly - and she has a substantial list of demands to be met as she visits three single men's homes. In the running is a rugby player, a trendy musician and a bodybuilder. Which one will she choose to go back to her house for a date?.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
programme.desc: The teenage wizard continues his search for the artefacts containing fragments of the dark lord Voldemort's soul. Time is running out, as the evil sorcerer is aware of Harry's mission, and marshals his forces for a final, devastating attack on Harry and his friends at Hogwarts school. Conclusion of the fantasy saga, with Daniel Radcliffe, Ralph Fiennes, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson and Alan Rickman.

programme.title: The ITV Election Debate
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham hosts a debate to which seven parties in the General Election campaign have been invited, ahead of the poll on December 12. The parties are the Conservatives, Labour, the Liberal Democrats, the SNP, the Brexit Party, the Greens and Plaid Cymru. Brexit is likely to be high on the agenda for this debate, along with issues including the NHS, crime, education and climate change.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: As the campmates face being booted out of the jungle back into their life of luxury, who is ready to make that jump and who wants to stay another day? Presented by Ant and Dec.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston narrates a selection of clips submitted by members of the public, which display in cringe-worthy detail some of the many things that can go wrong while away on holiday. A walk in the woods becomes a fight for survival, a man from Wales becomes a shark-wrestler, and an unfortunate holiday-maker ruins all his once-in-a-lifetime holiday snaps.

programme.title: Police, Camera, Auction
programme.desc: An insight into the auctions where criminals' assets from their nefarious activities are sold at auction, with the proceeds usually going to help those whose lives have been blighted by crime. From sports cars and designer goods to outrageous bling and strange collectibles, cameras reveal the broad range of criminals' possessions seized by specialist police teams and put under the hammer.The auctioneers and police discuss their work, while those victims who will benefit from the money wait anxiously to see the outcome of the sales.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.
